bioghist.p: Jerome Schapiro (b. 1930) was the president of Dixo Company, which was founded by his father, Sol Schapiro, in 1926. Dixo manufactured chemicals for the drycleaning industry and performed testing for drycleaning operations. Schapiro was an active member of several standards organizations, serving on a variety of committees focusing on textiles and chemical detergents. These include: the American Society of Testing and Materials (ASTM) Committees on Textiles and Detergents; American Association of Textile Chemists and Colorists (AATCC); American National Standards Institute (ANSI) Board of Directors, Executive Committee, and Consumer Council; International Organization for Standardization (ISO) Technical Committees on Surface Active Agents, Consumer Questions, Consumer Policy, and Textiles; and the National Institute of Drycleaning.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records from Schapiro's work on these various committees and includes meeting agendas and minutes, proposals for projects, reports of committee work, standards handbooks and manuals. Also included are some letters and other documents relating to Schapiro's work at Dixo Company.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
